Package controller

Class AddUpdateApptsController

java.lang.Object
controller.AddUpdateApptsController
public class AddUpdateApptsController extends Object
Controls the behavior of the AddUpdateAppts.fxml scene. Provides functionality to add new Appt or modify existing Appt, based on user input to the displayed form. lambda expression used her to define the setStage method of the functional interface SetStageInterface for use in other methods

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the form with existing data if Appt has Two lambda expressions (forEach) used to simplify code due to only having one parameter and one statement in the body to execute. been selected and modify button clicked on mainForm.

    • setModifiedAppt

      public static void setModifiedAppt(Appt appt)
      Sets modifiedAppt variable to selected Appt to be modified from the mainForm controller.
      Parameters:
      appt - the Appt to set

    • onApptCancel

      public void onApptCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Changes the current scene back to the MainForm.fxml. lambda expression used here to change current scene to MainForm.fxml
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event
      Throws:
      IOException - Catches any exceptions thrown during data input / output

    • onSaveAppt

      public void onSaveAppt(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Saves new or updated Appt to the database. Checks date and time user input for valid format, as well as checking to verify all combobox selections have been made. New Appt is either saved to database or an error message is displayed for user to correct. lambda expression used here to change current scene to MainForm.fxml upon successful save.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event
      Throws:
      IOException - Catches any exceptions thrown during data input / output

    • splitDateTime

      public String splitDateTime(String dateStr, String dateOrTime)
      Splits the combined date and time string from the database into two seperate strings placed into a string array.
      Parameters:
      dateStr - the date/time string to split.
      dateOrTime - which part of split string ("date" or "time") to return. "date" is the default. It will be returned unless "time" is sent as argument.
      Returns:
      either first or second index of string array, depending on value of dateOrTime parameter.

    • getUniqueId

      public static int getUniqueId()
      Iterates through integers with while loop starting at 1 and compares to existing Appointment_IDs to find unused integer for Appointment_ID
      Returns:
      the first unused integer found.
